title: The Art of War
author: Sun Tzu
description: Ancient Chinese military treatise on strategy, tactics, and the philosophy of warfare. Essential reading for understanding strategic thinking.

title: Meditations
author: Marcus Aurelius
description: Stoic philosophy and personal reflections of a Roman Emperor. Timeless wisdom on leadership, duty, and inner strength.

title: The Prince

description: Political treatise on power, leadership, and statecraft. Controversial yet insightful analysis of political strategy.

title: On War
author: Carl von Clausewitz
description: Comprehensive analysis of warfare theory and military strategy. The foundation of modern strategic thinking.

title: 48 Laws of Power
author: Robert Greene
description: Strategic guide to power dynamics and influence. Lessons from history's most successful leaders and tacticians.

title: The Book of Five Rings
author: Miyamoto Musashi
description: Japanese swordsman's guide to strategy and martial arts philosophy. Principles applicable to all forms of conflict.

title: Beyond Good and Evil
author: Friedrich Nietzsche
description: Philosophical critique of traditional morality and exploration of human nature and values.

title: Psychology of Intelligence Analysis
author: Richards Heuer
description: CIA analyst's guide to improving analytical thinking and avoiding cognitive biases in intelligence work.

title: Bhagavad Gita
author: Vyasa
description: Hindu philosophical text on duty, righteousness, and the nature of reality. Dialogue between Prince Arjuna and Lord Krishna.

title: Upanishads
author: Various Sages
description: Ancient Indian philosophical texts exploring the nature of ultimate reality and the self. Foundation of Vedantic thought.
